captions.text:
Order Mad as Hell on iTunes Available now
Now how is this for a great battle ISIS versus

Anonymous WWE round 37 right so look obviously
there's serious issues involved here and ISIS

is a disaster and they've done horrible things
and Anonymous fights back against everyone

who is trying to oppress people whether it
is at time the U.S. government or the Church

of Scientology in the past but now ISIS as
well I like that some reporters are surprised

by this Anonymous is on the side of the Americans
it's not a matter of being on the side Americans

it's a matter of those are clearly bad guys
and we're going to go help fighting against

them in fact the slogan of Anonymous is expect
us they didn't so they've got all these social

media accounts and they think their clever
and they're putting up videos of people getting

burned alive yadda yadda so here's what happens
as of Wednesday many of the ISIS site remained

inaccessible or disable after members of Anonymous
launched denial of service attacks flooding

the pages with traffic many of the Twitter
accounts appeared to be suspended well I pretty

much love this because you know we've got
our intelligence guys so called how could

you not trace a media account they're spying
in on this I mean we covered so many stories

they listen on phone sex of the troops in
Iraq in Britain a great percentage of the

pictures that they've found when they spotted
on British citizens were naked pictures and

the list goes on and on of all the private
calls and videos and pictures that they've

intercepted and listened to and viewed right
what are you doing you can't trace a simple

account here's anonymous oh boy this is really
hard to shut these guys down boom it's not

just pressing a button I assume they go through
some semantics to do it but it's fairly easy

for Anonymous just sitting there to go oh
yeah all their social media accounts done

OK now of course the U.S. government oh wait
wait your impeding on it's our domain here

they said according to The Hill this has led
some foreign policy experts to criticize Anonymous's

campaign on the ground that it could hurt
intelligence gathering to which I ask what

intelligence gathering others question the
effectiveness of the hacks because ISIS can

easily revive Web activities under new accounts
but you know what and then Anonymous could

also easily shut those down this could go
on for awhile if we have a hacking war I mean

if you're talking about machetes then ISIS
might have an advance you're talking about

computers I can assure you Anonymous has the
advantage so now look is it possible that

the U.S. intelligence agency are trying to
track those and actually get intelligence

from them I hope to go they are but so far
we haven't seen great evidence of that I mean

we remember the heroic story of how we traced
you know this social media account from Al

Qaeda or ISIS or other groups like the made
up Koroson group yeah yeah we caught them

no we didn't we found a courier a human being
to get Bin Laden right I mean I've never seen

any success I know they're supposed to be
secret right but whenever they have a big

success whether it's Bin Laden or anything
else they love to brag about it all of the

sudden the CIA the NSA is leaking all over
the place talking about oh look at us I mean

they did a whole movie called Zero Dark Thirty
where they bragged itís a piece of propaganda

right so I haven't seen them brag at about
how they trace the social media account but

all of a sudden when Anonymous embarrasses
them by doing it much better and easier more

efficient than the U.S. government all of
a sudden God damn anonymous getting in the

way we were just about to do that OK and then
I like this description in The Hill The Hill

is a fairly establishment press organization
and yet the increasingly savage displays by

ISIS have also brought a certain heroic quality
to Anonymous's efforts even if the group is

viewed as potentially dangerous anything that
counters the establishment and the American

government hasn't put its stamp of approval
on is seen as potentially dangerous now we

used to hate Anonymous and this is kind of
confusing but we kind of hate ISIS more how

to resolve this alright look for us it's incredibly
simple I get it Anonymous fights against those

who hold power and abuse whether that's the
American government or in the case of ISIS

the terrorists who are doing hideous things
in the middle easy kudos job well done

comments.text:
Everyone asks why Anonymous didnt do more. It makes it sound like theres a 
big ISIS sign with all their funds and people and secret info just there 
online and thats not the case. Just like anonymous, isis is spread out 
throughout the world. Not in big numbers, but there are followers. 
Anonymous is weeding out these local dangers by exposing them and scaring 
off potential new recruits because now they have the possibility of being 
exposed lingering over their heads. Its no longer run away and be secret. 
Even if it was a DDOS attack its better than nothing. We can't complain 
about free contributions against isis. I can fully say they've done more 
against isis in this one move than all of the people who viewed and 
commented on this video combined have so yeah..... I'll let them do what 
they want even if it is just ddos which i doubt is all they can do﻿
